user.title: Choose what you want to measure (what)
user.description:
Thank you for setting up MeasureIt!
If you need help with the configuration have a look at the [readme](https://github.com/danieldotnl/ha-measureit) or ask a question on the [community forum](https://community.home-assistant.io/t/measureit-measure-all-you-need-based-on-time-and-templates/660614).

Choose what you want to measure:
**Time:** Measure the elapsed time while conditions are met.
**Source:** Measure the state changes of a source entity, while conditions are met.
**Counter:** Measure the number of times something (described in a template) occurs, while conditions are met.

time.title: Configure time meter (what)
time.description: Provide a name for this configuration. It is used for sensor names and logging.

source.title: Configure source meter (what)
source.description: Provide a name for this configuration and a source entity. The name is used for sensor names and logging.

count.title: Configure a counting meter (what)
count.description: Configure the configuration name (used for sensor names and logging) and the counter template.

when.title: When do you want to measure? (when)
when.description:
Configure an optional condition (template). We will only measure when this template evaluates to `True`.
Then configure the days and time when you want to measure. *Default: always measure.*
When the *from* is later than the *till* time, it is assumed that the time window crosses midnight.

sensors.title: Configure the sensors (how)
sensors.description:
Configure the sensors. When in doubt, stick to the defaults. Individual sensor settings can be adjusted after this setup via 'configure'.

**Reset periods:** Select a predefined period to measure (when the meter will reset). Alternatively, provide a custom cron expression. Each period becomes a separate sensor.
**Value template:** A template that is applied on the output of the sensor. Use `value` to refer to the sensor state.
**Unit of measurement:** The unit of what your are measuring. E.g.: m3
**Device class:** Find more about device classes [here](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/sensor/#device-class).
**State class**: Find more about state classes [here](https://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/core/entity/sensor/#available-state-classes).

add_sensors.title: Add sensor(s)
add_sensors.description:
Add and configure one or more sensors. When in doubt, stick to the defaults.

**Reset periods:** Select the periods you want to measure (when the meter will reset). Each period becomes a separate sensor.
**Value template:** A template that is applied on the output of the sensor. Use `value` to refer to the sensor state.
**Unit of measurement:** The unit of what your are measuring. E.g.: m3
**Device class:** Find more about device classes [here](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/sensor/#device-class).
**State class**: Find more about state classes [here](https://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/core/entity/sensor/#available-state-classes).
